info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 12:03AM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern La Salle, northeastern Webb and west central McMullen Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1202 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Fort Ewell Site, or 23 miles northwest of Freer, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern La Salle, northeastern Webb and west central McMullen Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
